subject: Re: Friday fun ... write a JUnit test, make a buck (or $1.11 to be more precise)
msgSnippet: ... Hi Elliotte, You are right about that.  It s my first time using Mechanical Turk and I did not see (or notice) the qualification field - as I said, I m
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:

> Qualifications Required: None ?!
>
> It may be a trivial class, but I think there are a few qualifications
> here. :-)

Hi Elliotte,

You are right about that. It's my first time using Mechanical Turk
and I did not see (or notice) the qualification field - as I said, I'm
just playing around at this time.

I must say that, even though I find the idea of Mechanical Turk quite
intriguing, the interface is quite tricky to navigate and not very
complete (e.g. I did not find a way to edit existing tasks, just
expire them ahead of time).

Alberto

----------
http://www.junitfactory.com
Send it Java. Get back JUnit.
100% free and 100% experimental.
